_prev_prog_3.Description:
Americold, Murfreesboro - Rich (#75175) established a Process Safety Management (PSM) Program at this facility in May 22, 2002.  The PSM program includes all of the RMP Program 3 Prevention Program elements.  These elements and how they satisfy both the PSM and RMP regulations are shown in Table 1.

    TABLE 1  Prevention Program Compliance Matrix

Prevention Program             OSHA PS          Subsection EPA RMP Subsection
A) Employee Participation    1910.119                   40 CFR Part 68.83
B) Process Safety Information    1910.119                   40 CFR Part 68.65
C) Process Hazard Analysis    1910.119               40 CFR Part 68.67
D) Operating Procedures            1910.119                40 CFR Part 68.69
E) Training                     1910.119                40 CFR Part 68.71
F) Contractors                    1910.119                40 CFR Part 68.87
G) Pre-Startup Safety Review    1910.119             40 CFR Part 68.77
H) Mechanical Integrity            1910.119                40 CFR Part 68.73
I) Hot Work Permit            1910.119                40 CFR Part 68.85
J) Management of Change            1910.119                   40 CFR Part 68.75
K) Incident Investigation    1910.119                40 CFR Part 68.81
L) Emergency Planning & Response1910.119                40 CFR Part 68.
M) Compliance Audits            1910.119                40 CFR Part 68.79

The prevention program elements included in Table 1 are detailed in the Americold, Murfreesboro - Rich (#75175) Facility Process Safety Management notebook.  This document is maintained by the Facility Service Manager.  In addition to the Process Safety Management notebook, the Facility Service Manager maintains  Piping Diagrams and IIAR safety review Form.  This material includes the piping diagrams for each piece of ammonia refrigeration equipment as well as the International Institute of Ammonia Refrigeration Bulletin 109 forms.  These forms include physical as well as operational data for each piece of ammonia refrigeration equipment.Americold Logistics, LLC establishes a Process Safety Management (PSM) progeam at this facility in May 22, 2002. The PSM program includes all of the RMP Program 3 Prevention Program elements.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
7.0  RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN AND DATA ELEMENTS
The following subsections outline the Executive Summary requirements of the EPAA?s 40 CFR Part 68.155.

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES
The Americold, Murfreesboro - Rich's (Plant #75175) facility abides by the emergency response procedures and policies detailed in the Emergency Response Plan manual.  This Plan was designed to meet the following objectives:
To save lives.
To minimize and avoid injuries.
To protect the environment.
To minimize property damage.

Americold, Murfreesboro - Rich's (Plant #75175) maintains an emergency response (safety) committee whose members are the designated emergency coordinators for the facility.  The Plan provides the response organization and notification procedures, evacuation routes, ammonia health hazards, and mitigation procedures which were implemented to respond effectively to emergency situations that may arise at the facility.  This Plan is reviewed and updated at least once per year.  This Plan will be reviewed and updated to ensure compliance with the PSM and RMP regulations, as well as to incorporate any facility changes. 

STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE
The Americold, Murfreesboro - Rich's (Plant #75175) facility chills and stores a variety of food products in their cold storage warehouse.  The refrigeration process, consisting of piping, valves, and equipment, cycles ammonia through various physical states (high pressure liquid, low pressure liquid, low pressure vapor, high pressure vapor, then back to high pressure liquid) in order to provide refrigeration for cold storage rooms.  Changes in pressure are directly related to changes in temperature.  For example, lowering the ammonia pressure lowers its temperature.  Low-pressure (cold) liquid ammonia provides refrigeration by removing ambient heat.  Removal of ambient heat causes the liquid ammonia (contained within the system) to vaporize.  Heat is later removed from the ammonia as i

t is condensed back into a liquid.  Typical operating conditions range from vacuum (approximately 6A? Hg) on the low-pressure side of the system to 150-160 psig on the high side.

Anhydrous Ammonia (CAS #7664-41-7) is used as the refrigerant in the refrigeration process.

The total ammonia inventory is above the Threshold Quantity for Accidental Release Prevention.

HAZARD ASSESSMENT SUMMARY
Worst Case Release Result Summary
Discussion removed per regulation

Alternative Release Result Summary
Discussion removed per regulation

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS
The facility operates in accordance with the International Institute of Ammonia Refrigeration (IIAR) guidelines and standards including the following:

IIAR Bulletin 107, A?Suggested Safety and Operating Procedures When Making Ammonia Refrigeration Tie-insA?
IIAR Bulletin 109, A?Minimum Safety Criteria for a Safe Ammonia Refrigeration SystemA?
IIAR, A?A Guide to Good Practices for the Operation of an Ammonia Refrigeration SystemA?

In addition, the AmeriCold Logistics, Inc. Plant 75175 has implemented a Process Safety Management program for compliance with the OSHA 1910.119 regulation since May 2002

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY
There have been no RMP reportable accidents at this facility from the five years.   

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM
 Americold, Murfreesboro - Rich's (Plant #75175) has an Emergency Response Program in place.  The facility has an Emergency Response Team that is trained to First Responder Operations Level on an annual basis.  All Emergency Response Team members are fit tested and respiratory trained annually.   

During the RMP Development Review, it was recommended that the facility conduct annual evacuation drills to ensure all employees understand the emergency response procedures. In addition, it was recommended that the facility contact the local Fire Department regarding participation in the evacuation drills.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFE

TY
During review of the Process Safety Management program at this facility, the validation of Process Hazard Analysis study April 2007 generated mitigation measures that would improve safety at the Americold facility located at 720 Butler Drive, Murfreesboro, TN 37129.  These action items were entered into a management system and addressed.

In addition to the equipment related mitigation measures recommended to improve safety at this facility, the RMP Development Team made several procedural/managerial recommendations to improve safety.  These recommendations are a result of the review of the PSM prevention programs and the Emergency Response Program for preparation of the Risk Management Program and Plan. These action items were entered into a management system and addressed.
